result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandre L. Avery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED or HSED.  Vocational assessment.  Participate in any programs recommended.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association  with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
*Conditons apply to all counts/this case.
Pay on the Child Support Order

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

Set at $13,433.46 payable to Wiscosin Support Collections Trust Fund. Restitution already assessed on case 14CF2341.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deandre L. Avery in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Deandre L. Avery in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 1/2 YEARS  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 135 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving the first 6 months of sentence; and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $ 13,433.46 payable to Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund; bail on deposit to be applied to this amount.  Remaining balance are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as this will create financial hardship as defendant has a large amount of arrages to pay. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Attend parenting classes
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Pay on the child support order 

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 3 consecutive to COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving the first 6 months of sentence; and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $ 13,433.46 payable to Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund; bail on deposit to be applied to this amount.  Remaining balance are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as this will create financial hardship as defendant has a large amount of arrages to pay. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Attend parenting classes
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Pay on the child support order 

AS TO COUNT 3:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 2 consecutive to COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving the first 6 months of sentence; and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $ 13,433.46 payable to Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund; bail on deposit to be applied to this amount.  Remaining balance are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervison; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as this will create financial hardship as defendant has a large amount of arrages to pay. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended

-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers

Per request for substitution against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Brash's Court.
against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Brash's Court.

Defendant Deandre L. Avery in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Deandre L. Avery in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.

ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
